discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
“Cisco digital signal processor (DSP) resources are used for transcoding and conferencing. The modules, which are available for use with Cisco CallManager, can perform conferencing, Media Termination Point (MTP), and transcoding services in addition to serving as a PSTN gateway.”

questions.question_text:
An engineer must add resources to a Cisco Catalyst gateway that is currently used to route calls to and from the PSTN to provide these additional services:

• conferencing
• transcoding

What must be added to the gateway?

choices.D: Cisco IP Voice Media Streaming application

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An administrator must fix the SRV records to ensure that server1.sample.com is always contacted first from the three servers. Which solution should the engineer apply to resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
What is the difference between priority and weight in SRV records?
SRV records indicate the "priority" and "weight" of the various servers they list. The "priority" value in an SRV record enables administrators to prioritize one server that supports the given service over another. A server with a lower priority value will receive more traffic than other servers. However, the "weight" value is similar: a server with a higher weight will receive more traffic than other servers with the same priority.

The main difference between them is that priority is looked at first. If there are three servers, Server A, Server B, and Server C, and they have respective priorities of 10, 20, and 30, then their "weight" does not matter. The service will always query Server A first.

But suppose Servers A, B, and C all have a priority of 10 — how will a service choose between them? This is where weight becomes a factor: if Server A has a "weight" value of 5 and Servers B and C have a "weight" value of 3 and 2, Server A will receive the most traffic, Server B will receive the second-most traffic, and Server C the third-most.

Selected Answer: A
Priority checked first. Lower value priority is More Preffered. If there's a tie in priority, higher value weight is More Preffered. So answer is A.

comments.content: Lower the priority sorry and then answer A :D

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The only way to server 1 to be contacted ALWAYS first is to upscale the Priority so it's the answer C

The main difference between them is that priority is looked at first. If there are three servers, Server A, Server B, and Server C, and they have respective priorities of 10, 20, and 30, then their "weight" does not matter. The service will always query Server A first. So Server 3 is the answer

questions.question_text:
An engineer must configure a new Cisco UCM route pattern. When a user at extension 5555 and external phone number mask XXXX dials 911 or 9911, these requirements must be met:

• Both patterns must be accepted.
• Only the number 911 must be sent to the gateway.
• A caller ID of 555-555-5555 must be sent to the gateway.
• All transformations must be done at the route pattern level.

Which two route patterns must be used? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
B. No option for discard digits with the calling party tranformations
C. External phone number mask set does not match 5555555555
E. Again, no option for discard digits with the calling party tranformations

Selected Answer: AD
Gary1968 has explained everything already

questions.question_text: Which dial plan design provides the most benefit to systems with many sites or overlapping site extension ranges?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Please check a CUCM menu in any version, you can validate it is Bulk Administration --> Phones --> Add/Update Lines --> Update Lines

Selected Answer: C
Answer could possibly be C as the question mentions phones, not specifically lines and the steps are valid to update the CSS at the phone level.

comments.content: Thinking about it further, it is more sound to update the CSS at the line level, because even though the device level CSS and line level CSS get concatenated the line level CSS will take precedence more often than not. I will change my vote to D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A is wrong, such menu choice does not exist. Secondly Phones in bulk is updating device level settings not line level settings.

D is the correct menu choice to update line level settings

choices.C: From Phones, select Update Phones, and then click Query.
choices.D: From Phones, select Add/Update Lines, and then click Update Lines.
choices.A: From Phones, select Update Phones, and then click Update Lines.

questions.question_text: A company wants to block all users from forwarding calls to international destinations. An engineer must configure a calling search space named NATIONAL across all phones for call forwarding by using the Bulk Administration Tool. Which action must the engineer take from Bulk Administration in Cisco UCM Administration?
